Meall Ghaordaidh

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Meall Ghaordaidh is not a particularly distinguished peak. The usual ascent from Glen Lochay reveals it is a featureless lump. It does look finer from Glen Lyon to the north, supported by two buttresses.

 You have not climbed Meall Ghaordaidh.

Region: Perthshire

Altitude: 1039 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.87/5
Rating: 2.9/5 (107 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Meall Ghaordaidh from Glen Lochay

Other routes and challenges

The mountain can also be ascended from the north, crossing a bridge over the River Lyon at NN 512 420 and heading up into Coire Loaghain.

The route can also be extended to cross a bealach at 638m and take in the neighbouring Corbett, Beinn nan Oighreag.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Perthshire Hotels

Perthshire B&B

Perthshire Cottages

Perthshire Hostels
